sen.j: 五条大橋（ごじょうおおはし）は、京都府京都市を流れる鴨川に掛かる橋。
sen.e: Gojo-ohashi Bridge is a bridge over Kamogawa-River which runs through Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Gojo-ohashi Bridge is a bridge over Kamogawa-River which runs through Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Gojo-ohashi Bridge is a bridge over the Kamo-gawa River which runs through Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Kamo-gawa River としました。"Kamo-gawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 橋上を五条通（国道1号）が通る。
sen.e: Gojyo-dori Street (Route 1) runs on the bridge.
Gojyo-dori Street (Route 1) runs on the bridge.
Gojo-dori Street (National Route 1) runs on the bridge.

sen.j: 下京区と東山区の境界でもある。
sen.e: It is also on the boundary between Shimogyo-ku and Higashiyama-ku.
It is also on the boundary between Shimogyo-ku and Higashiyama-ku.
It is also on the boundary between Shimogyo Ward and Higashiyama Ward.

sen.j: 橋上からは比叡山などの山を見渡すことができる。
sen.e: You can have a great view of Mt. Hiei and other mountains from this bridge.
There is a great view of Mt. Hiei and other mountains from this bridge.
There is a great view of Mt. Hiei and other mountains from this bridge.

sen.j: 五条大橋は武蔵坊弁慶と源義経の伝説で有名であり、橋の西側、河原町通との交差点近くのグリーンベルト内には、その状景を模した京人形（御所人形）風の2体の石像を見ることもできる。
sen.e: Gojo-ohashi Bridge is famous for the legendary story of Benkei MUSASHIBO and Yoshitsune MINAMOTO, and their stone statues of the Kyo-ningyo (gosho-ningyou) (or Kyoto doll) style stand in the green belt on the west side of the bridge close to the cross-section of Kawaramachi-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.

Gojo-ohashi Bridge is famous for the legendary story of Benkei MUSASHIBO and Yoshitsune MINAMOTO, and their stone statues in the style of a Kyoto doll or Kyo-ningyo (gosho-ningyou) stand in the green belt on the west side of the bridge close to the cross-section of Kawaramachi-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました - in order to remove the two sets of paretheses next to each other I rearranged the central part of this sentence.
sen.e: Gojo-ohashi Bridge is famous for the legendary story of Musashibo Benkei and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, and their stone statues in the style of a Kyoto doll or Kyo-ningyo (gosho-ningyo) stand in the green belt on the west side of the bridge close to the cross-section of Kawaramachi-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 人名の表記を修正しました。

sen.j: 但し、平安時代の五条通は、現在の松原通であり、当時の「五条の橋」は、現在の松原橋辺りであった、あるいは鴨川には橋がなく西洞院通であったとも推定されている。
sen.e: However, Gojo-dori during Heian Period turned to be the present Matsubara-dori Street, and an explanation says "Gojo-no-hashi" of that time used to be near present Matsubara-bshi Bridge, and another explanation says it was Nishinotoin-dori Street as no bridge was over Kamogawa River.

However, Gojo-dori Street during the Heian Period has become the present Matsubara-dori Street, and one theory suggests the "Gojo-no-hashi"bridge of that time used to be near the present Matsubara-bashi Bridge, and another theory proposes that it was Nishinotoin-dori Street as no bridge was over Kamogawa River.
sen.cmt: 「street」挿入, 「the」挿入x2,「to be」→「has become」, 「an explanation says」→「one theory suggests」,「bridge」挿入,「bshi」→「bashi」,「explanation says」→「theory proposes that」
sen.e: However, Gojo-dori Street during the Heian period has become the present Matsubara-dori Street, and one theory suggests the 'Gojo-no-hashi' bridge of that time used to be near the present Matsubara-bashi Bridge, and another theory proposes that it was Nishinotoin-dori Street as no bridge was over the Kamo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。Kamo-gawa River としました。"Kamo-gawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: また、橋の西北側には、かつてこの地にあった御影堂（新善光寺）扇にちなんだ扇塚がある。
sen.e: At the foot of the Gojo-ohashi Bridge on the western side stands Ogizuka related to Mieido (shinzenko-ji Temple) fans that used be produced here.
At the foot of Gojo-ohashi Bridge on the western side stands Ogizuka after the Mieido (Shinzenko-ji Temple) fans that used be produced here.
sen.cmt: 「the」削除, 「related to」→「after the」The temple name has also been given a capital letter. I think Ogizuka needs an English explanation.
sen.e: At the foot of Gojo-ohashi Bridge on the northwestern side stands Ogizuka (literally, a fan mound) after the Mieido (Shinzenko-ji Temple) fans that used be produced here.
sen.cmt: 扇塚の補足として、 (literally, a fan mound) と追加しました。西北 としました。

sen.j: 橋の東側は、地下に京阪電気鉄道の五条駅_(京阪)がある。
sen.e: Underground at the east side of the bridge is Gojo Station (Keihan) of Keihan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd.
Underground at the east side of the bridge is Gojo Station (Keihan) run by the Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
Underground at the east side of the bridge is Gojo Station (Keihan) run by the Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: また、その東に伸びる五条通が、西大谷や清水寺へと続く五条坂である。
sen.e: Gojo-dori Street extends eastward to Gojo-zaka Slope which leads to Nishi-otani and Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
Gojo-dori Street extends eastward to Gojo-zaka Slope which leads to Nishi-otani and Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
Gojo-dori Street extends eastward to Gojo-zaka Slope which leads to Nishi-otani and Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
